item.description:
Taoist Meditation & Chinese Cultural Arts

The SunDo-Taoist Center is pleased to host Hai-yan, a Chinese cultural ambassador who will present both a Chinese tea ceremony and a rendition of traditional guzheng music (watch video). A guzheng (pronounced "Goo-Zheng") is a plucked string instrument that is part of the zither family. It is one of the most ancient Chinese musical instruments. The playing creates special tonalities that captivate listeners and touch their souls with its beautiful music.   

 

Hai-yan is not only adept at playing the guzheng, she is also a tea master. As co-founder of Lotus Leaf Tea Company, Hai-yan enjoys educating others about the health benefits of high-quality whole leaf tea and traditional Chinese culture. After the tea ceremony, Hai-yan will play an interpretation on the guzheng

of the classic song...

Wiseman Singing in a Fishing Boat.

 

Meetup members are invited to enjoy the playing of this most beautiful Chinese instrument with a history of more than 2000 years. This event is $10 for meetup members and $20 for the general public.  

 
Before the tea ceremony and recital, join us for a one hour meditation with light stretching. Please wear comfy clothing. No previous experience necessary. All physical fitness levels are welcome. Practice can be adapted to suit individual needs.

 

Taoist meditation is a method for cultivating, refining, and circulating internal energy within the chakras and meridian channels in the body. Taoists believe that breathing and energy meditation fills the reservoirs of the chakras and meridian with energy, which is then distributed to all the major organ systems.
item.why: it will be a relaxing evening of music, meditation and tea.
item.name: Taoist Meditation & Chinese Cultural Arts
